contents: Article 29 (Attendance Request) ① When the Committee requests attendance of a person suspected of disciplinary action, an attendance request form in the form of Appendix 5 must be delivered to the person suspected of disciplinary action 7 days prior to the meeting of the Committee. In this case, except in cases where the attendance request letter is sent to the head of the organization to which the person suspected of disciplinary action is to be delivered pursuant to paragraph 3, a copy of the request for attendance must also be sent to the head of the organization to which the person suspected of disciplinary action belongs, and the head of the organization to which the person suspected of disciplinary action belongs is to be sent to the head of the organization to which the person suspected of disciplinary action belongs. Must cooperate in attendance. ② Notwithstanding paragraph 1, in the case of urgent matters such as violations falling under items 6 to 11 of Appendix 1 (hereinafter referred to as *rights infringement cases), the person suspected of disciplinary action shall be notified at least 3 days prior to the meeting of the committee. Attendance may be requested (in writing, by phone, email, etc.). Revised December 26, 2022. ③ When the Committee determines that it is difficult to send the attendance request pursuant to paragraph 1 directly to the disciplinary suspect because the address of the disciplinary suspect is unknown or for other reasons, it sends the attendance request pursuant to paragraph 1 to the disciplinary suspect. It can be sent to the head of the organization to which it belongs and have it delivered. In this case, the head of the affiliated organization who has received the attendance request must deliver it to the person suspected of disciplinary action without delay. ④ If the person suspected of disciplinary action does not wish to appear and make a statement, the Committee may have the person submit a waiver of statement, attach it to the record, and decide on disciplinary action only after a written review. ⑤ If the person suspected of disciplinary action does not submit a justifiable reason for non-attendance, the Committee may consider that the person does not wish to attend, record the fact, and decide on disciplinary action based on written review. ⑥ If the committee determines that the person suspected of disciplinary action is unable to appear within 30 days from the date of sending the attendance request due to staying abroad, being detained for a criminal case, or for any other reason, the committee may have the person make a statement in writing and decide on disciplinary action, etc. In this case, if no statement is made in writing, a disciplinary decision may be made without the statement. ⑦ If a person suspected of disciplinary action refuses to receive an attendance request, he or she is deemed to have waived his or her right to make a statement before the committee. However, a person suspected of disciplinary action may appear before the committee and make a statement even if he or she refuses to receive the attendance request.
